analyzed: vimāna vatthu  itthi vimāna  pīṭha vagga
translated: The Mansion Chapter🔽The Divine Maiden’s Mansion🔽The Chapter about a Seat
The Divine Maiden’s Mansion about an Elephant
“Your elephant is a fine mount,
adorned with various jewels;
Beautiful, strong, and swift,
he moves through the sky.🔽He has lotus flowers, lotus petals,🔽and a goad made of lotus flowers;
His body is covered with lotus pollen,
and he wears a garland of golden lotuses.🔽The path he follows is covered with lotus flowers,🔽and he is adorned with lotus petals;
He stands out, beautiful and majestic,
as the elephant moves along in moderation.
As he moves along,
golden and bronze bells;
Their sound is heard,
like a five-part musical instrument.
On the elephant’s back,
adorned with a pure cloth,
a large group of celestial nymphs,
you shine with your beauty.

original: Dānassa te idaṁ phalaṁ,🔽atho sīlassa vā pana;
analyzed: dānassa te idam phala  atho sīlassa vā pana
translated: Is this the fruit of generosity,🔽or is it of virtue,
or is it of paying respect with joined palms?
Please tell me this, when asked.”
The deity, satisfied,🔽when asked by Moggallāna,
answered the question,
is the result of that deed.
“Having seen the one endowed with virtues,
the sage who delights in jhāna,
I gave him a seat covered with flowers,
a seat made of cloth.
I placed a garland of lotuses
all around the seat,
and I sprinkled it with water
with my own pure hands.
Because of that skillful deed,
this is the kind of result I have:
I have honored and respected

original: devānaṁ apacitā ahaṁ.🔽Yo ve sammāvimuttānaṁ,🔽santānaṁ brahmacārinaṁ;

translated: the gods.🔽One who, with faith, gives a seat🔽to those who are well liberated,
to those who are peaceful and live the spiritual life,
will rejoice as I do.
Therefore, one who desires their own welfare,
